title: Russland med krystallklar advarsel
cleaned_sentences: The Ukraine War Russia with crystal clear warning In a TV interview with Russia-24 Wednesday, the Russian Foreign Ministry comes with a clear message.
A spokesman for the Russian Foreign Ministry, Maria Zakharova, comes on Wednesday with strong warnings to our neighboring countries Sweden and Finland.
Russia fears that the two countries will apply for NATO membership.
- We have given our warnings, both public and through bilateral channels.
They know this, so there is nothing to be surprised.
They were informed of everything, where it would lead, says Zakharova.
Record high support The startling statement should have emerged in a TV interview with the channel Russia-24, reproduced by the state-owned news agency Tass.
Exactly what consequences will come from a future NATO membership is not specified.
On the same day came the news of a record high NATO support in Sweden, where a new poll shows that 57 percent respond to membership.
Such a high number as 57 is startling, says Demoscop boss Karin Nelsson, according to NTB.
Is in progress debate In Finland, the debate is in full swing Wednesday.
A security policy report presented during the Easter week now forms the basis for whether the country will consider NATO membership.
Although the government did not come up with a direct recommendation, the report contains several points on how a potential membership will benefit the country.
After Russia invaded Ukraine, support must have changed in favor of membership, reports NTB.
It is expected that both countries will decide well in advance of the Madrid summit in late June.
